task_summary: Pick up the white plate and place it on top of the red plate.

task_long_description.overview: An xArm manipulator must grasp a shallow white plate lying on a green mat and place it onto a red plate target. The contact sheet shows approach, grasp, lift, transfer toward the red plate, a controlled descent to contact, release, and retreat. The gripper begins empty. The plan prioritizes reliable perception of both plates, a top grasp, gentle vertical approach/retreat motions, and a low-speed, contact-based placement to avoid sliding.
preconditions: White plate and red plate visible in workspace
No obstacles between robot and plates
Robot is homed and reachable poses are collision-free
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect the white plate.
Move above the white plate, compute a top grasp, align and pick.
Detect the red plate and move above it.
Align over the red plate, descend slowly until contact.
Open gripper to release the white plate onto the red plate.
success_criteria: White plate is released on top of the red plate surface
No drop or excessive sliding during placement
Robot retreats clear of objects with gripper open
failure_and_recovery: If object not visible: re-detect target and reattempt approach
If grasp unstable: reopen, recompute grasp, repeat pick
If no contact detected while lowering: abort descent, re-align and try again
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after successful release on the red plate and final retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Ensure gripper is open before approaching the object.
Confirm the white plate is visible.
Move to a safe pre-grasp pose above the white plate.
Compute a top grasp pose for the plate.
Refine position and orientation to grasp tolerance.
Execute the grasp and close gripper.
Lift the object to a safe height.
Confirm the red plate is visible.
Center over the red plate for placement.
Descend gently until contact is detected.
Release the white plate onto the red plate.
Back off to a safe pose after placement.

failure_modes: White plate not detected due to glare
recovery_strategy: Increase approach height and try new path
Abort descent, re-center, and lower again
assumptions: Frames show a successful top grasp of the white plate followed by motion toward the red plate.
Exact placement pose is not provided; a contact-based placement (LowerUntilContact + release) is used instead of PlaceAt.

expected_success_criteria: White plate ends centered on the red plate with minimal slip
